title: 114_hr5480
content: The Act is titled the "Boosting Equity for the American Middle Class Act of 2016" or the "BEAM Act of 2016." It introduces a refundable credit for early principal payments on certain home mortgages under a new section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The BEAM Act of 2016 introduces a credit for excess home mortgage principal payments made by individuals, equal to 50% of the payments, with an annual limit of $500. There is a lifetime limit of 10 years and a limitation based on modified adjusted gross income. The credit is subject to a limitation based on modified adjusted gross income for taxable years. The credit is subject to a limitation based on modified adjusted gross income for taxable years, defined as adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under specific sections. The BEAM Act of 2016 introduces a credit for excess home mortgage principal payments made by individuals, equal to 50% of the payments, with an annual limit of $500. The term 'qualified home mortgage indebtedness' refers to acquisition indebtedness on the taxpayer's primary residence that constitutes a traditional mortgage. The term 'traditional mortgage' refers to indebtedness with a term of 15-30 years, with equal payments made at regular intervals. The credit under this section is not allowed for married individuals filing separately unless they file a joint return. If the credit is allowed for a joint return, it is treated as allowed to both spouses for that taxable year. The taxpayer is treated as having been allowed the credit under subsection (a) for 10 or more preceding taxable years only if both spouses have been allowed such credits. Reporting of excess home mortgage principal payments is also required. The taxpayer must report excess home mortgage principal payments received during the year. Amendments are made to sections in the Internal Revenue Code to include references to section 36C. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include inserting a new item after section 36B, referencing section 36C. Section 36C introduces early principal payments on certain home mortgages, with amendments applying to taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act.
